chargeHist.descr: Purchase Pseudoephedrine for Another with Intent/Facilitate Another Person's Manufacture of Meth

result.execSummary:
The defendant Crystal S. Schirmacher was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Crystal S. Schirmacher is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Crystal S. Schirmacher was found guilty of Purchase Pseudoephedrine for Another with Intent/Facilitate Another Person's Manufacture of Meth [Modifiers: Conspiracy to Commit], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.453(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
09:40 a.m. Defendant Crystal S. Schirmacher in court with attorney Matthew Loren Goldin.  Defendant Crystal S. Schirmacher in custody.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State moves to dismiss Count 1 but read in for purposes of sentencing - Granted.   Plea questionaire filed.  Defendant enters no contest plea. Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty.  Schiek/Goldin/Defendant/Court statements to sentencing. Ineligible Voting Notice given.
Court Sentence
WHS/POP 2 yrs
CC/DNA Surcharge/Supervision Fees
Jail credit 134 days
Any conditions/counseling deemed appropriate by PO
Appeal rights given
Adj. 09:55 a.m.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 08-07-2015 09:30 am

10:14 am - Defendant Crystal S. Schirmacher in court with attorney Matthew Loren Goldin, appearing telephonically with leave of the court.  Defendant Crystal S. Schirmacher in custody.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Schiek states proposal sent.  Goldin states sentencing after revocation to be held in Outagamie County and is requesting the sentencing on this case be held after the revocation sentencing.  Bail continued.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 14, 2015 at 11:30 am.
Pre-trial conference at 06-26-2015 10:00 am

2:05 p.m. Defendant Crystal S. Schirmacher in court, in custody, with attorney Matthew Loren Goldin. Steven Mitchell Michlig, Asst. D.A., appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant waives preliminary hearing; waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that probable cause exists and binds over. Defendant in receipt of Information; waives reading. Defendant pleads not guilty to all counts. Bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 26, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
States Reply to Discovery  and State's Demand for Discovery
Preliminary hearing at 05-22-2015 02:00 pm

02:51 pm - Defendant Crystal S. Schirmacher in court, via video,  with attorney Matthew Loren Goldin appearing telephonically with leave of the court.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  In receipt of complaint, waive reading - set for prelim - time limits waived.  Bail continued.  If prelim is to be a waiver, attorney may appear telephonically.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 22, 2015 at 03:30 pm.
no contact w/Jaime S. Rickert and/or Michael J. Steinmetz, Jr., may not possess or obtain psuedoephendrine unless has valid prescription from medical provider

03:13 pm - GBA for PFO - Defendant Crystal S. Schirmacher in court, via video, in custody.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court questions defendant as to obtaining counsel.  Has contacted PD office several times - PD office has not been able to find an attorney to represent as of today's date.  Court adjourns. Bednar statement to modify bond - Granted.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for April 27, 2015 at 02:30 pm.

02:46 pm - MAM for PFO - Defendant Crystal S. Schirmacher in court, via video, in custody.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is eligible for PD - PD office unable to appoint attorney at this time - told defendant to call back.  Court grants adjournment.  Defendant requests modification to bond - Currently set at $4,000 cash with conditions.  Currently on probation hold.  Court will not grant motion.  Bail continued.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for April 20, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
no contact w/Jaime S. Rickert and/or Michael J. Steinmetz, Jr.

01:28 pm - Defendant Crystal S. Schirmacher in court, via video,  in custody.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  In receipt of complaint, right to counsel - defendant will contact PD,  Schiek statement to bail - Court sets $ cash bond.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for March 30, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
